title: Roman emperor Caligula accepts the titles of the Principate, bestowed on him by the Senate.
text: Roman emperor Caligula accepts the titles of the Principate, bestowed on him by the Senate.

title: Roman Emperor Pertinax is assassinated by Praetorian Guards, who then sell the throne to Didius Julianus in an auction.
text: Roman Emperor Pertinax is assassinated by Praetorian Guards, who then sell the throne to Didius Julianus in an auction.

title: Roman Emperor Valentinian I appoints his brother Flavius Valens co-emperor.
text: Roman Emperor Valentinian I appoints his brother Flavius Valens co-emperor.

title: The foundation stone of Valletta, Malta's capital city, is laid by Jean Parisot de Valette, Grand Master of the Sovereign Military Order of Malta.
text: The foundation stone of Valletta, Malta's capital city, is laid by Jean Parisot de Valette, Grand Master of the Sovereign Military Order of Malta.

title: The Marathas under Baji Rao I attack and defeat the Mughals in the Battle of Delhi
text: The Marathas under Baji Rao I attack and defeat the Mughals in the Battle of Delhi

title: Juan Bautista de Anza finds the site for the Presidio of San Francisco.
text: Juan Bautista de Anza finds the site for the Presidio of San Francisco.

title: Allies under Prince Josias of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld defeat French forces at Le Cateau.
text: Allies under Prince Josias of Saxe-Coburg-Saalfeld defeat French forces at Le Cateau.

title: Partitions of Poland: The Duchy of Courland and Semigallia, a northern fief of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, ceases to exist and becomes part of Imperial Russia.
text: Partitions of Poland: The Duchy of Courland and Semigallia, a northern fief of the Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth, ceases to exist and becomes part of Imperial Russia.

title: Treaty of Florence is signed.
text: Treaty of Florence is signed.

title: Heinrich Wilhelm Matthäus Olbers discovers 2 Pallas, the second asteroid ever to be discovered.
text: Heinrich Wilhelm Matthäus Olbers discovers 2 Pallas, the second asteroid ever to be discovered.

title: Peninsular War: France defeats Spain in the Battle of Medellín.
text: Peninsular War: France defeats Spain in the Battle of Medellín.

title: War of 1812: In the Battle of Valparaíso, two American naval vessels are captured by two Royal Navy vessels of equal strength.
text: War of 1812: In the Battle of Valparaíso, two American naval vessels are captured by two Royal Navy vessels of equal strength.

title: First concert of the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Otto Nicolai.
text: First concert of the Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra, conducted by Otto Nicolai.

title: Crimean War: France and Britain declare war on Russia.
text: Crimean War: France and Britain declare war on Russia.

title: First Taranaki War: The Battle of Waireka begins.
text: First Taranaki War: The Battle of Waireka begins.

title: American Civil War: In the Battle of Glorieta Pass, Union forces stop the Confederate invasion of the New Mexico Territory. The battle began on March 26.
text: American Civil War: In the Battle of Glorieta Pass, Union forces stop the Confederate invasion of the New Mexico Territory. The battle began on March 26.

title: The Paris Commune is formally established in Paris.
text: The Paris Commune is formally established in Paris.

title: Tonkin Campaign: French victory in the Battle of Gia Cuc.
text: Tonkin Campaign: French victory in the Battle of Gia Cuc.

title: Henri Fabre becomes the first person to fly a seaplane, the Fabre Hydravion, after taking off from a water runway near Martigues, France.
text: Henri Fabre becomes the first person to fly a seaplane, the Fabre Hydravion, after taking off from a water runway near Martigues, France.

title: Palm Sunday tornado outbreak of 1920 affects the Great Lakes region and Deep South states.
text: Palm Sunday tornado outbreak of 1920 affects the Great Lakes region and Deep South states.

title: The Imperial Airways biplane City of Liverpool is believed to be the first airliner lost to sabotage when a passenger sets a fire on board.
text: The Imperial Airways biplane City of Liverpool is believed to be the first airliner lost to sabotage when a passenger sets a fire on board.

title: Spanish Civil War: Generalissimo Francisco Franco conquers Madrid after a three-year siege.
text: Spanish Civil War: Generalissimo Francisco Franco conquers Madrid after a three-year siege.

title: World War II: Britain's Mediterranean Fleet sinks three heavy cruisers and two destroyers of Italy's Regia Marina.
text: World War II: Britain's Mediterranean Fleet sinks three heavy cruisers and two destroyers of Italy's Regia Marina.

title: World War II: A British combined force permanently disables the Louis Joubert Lock in Saint-Nazaire in order to keep the German battleship Tirpitz away from the mid-ocean convoy lanes.
text: World War II: A British combined force permanently disables the Louis Joubert Lock in Saint-Nazaire in order to keep the German battleship Tirpitz away from the mid-ocean convoy lanes.

title: Cold War: The United States Department of State releases the Acheson–Lilienthal Report, outlining a plan for the international control of nuclear power.
text: Cold War: The United States Department of State releases the Acheson–Lilienthal Report, outlining a plan for the international control of nuclear power.

title: First Indochina War: In the Battle of Mạo Khê, French Union forces, led by World War II hero Jean de Lattre de Tassigny, inflict a defeat on Việt Minh forces commanded by General Võ Nguyên Giáp.
text: First Indochina War: In the Battle of Mạo Khê, French Union forces, led by World War II hero Jean de Lattre de Tassigny, inflict a defeat on Việt Minh forces commanded by General Võ Nguyên Giáp.

title: The State Council of the People's Republic of China dissolves the government of Tibet.
text: The State Council of the People's Republic of China dissolves the government of Tibet.

title: Brazilian high school student Edson Luís de Lima Souto is killed by military police at a protest for cheaper meals at a restaurant for low-income students.
text: Brazilian high school student Edson Luís de Lima Souto is killed by military police at a protest for cheaper meals at a restaurant for low-income students.

title: Greek poet and Nobel Prize laureate Giorgos Seferis makes a famous statement on the BBC World Service opposing the junta in Greece.
text: Greek poet and Nobel Prize laureate Giorgos Seferis makes a famous statement on the BBC World Service opposing the junta in Greece.

title: An earthquake strikes western Turkey at about 23:05 local time, killing 1,086 and injuring 1,260.
text: An earthquake strikes western Turkey at about 23:05 local time, killing 1,086 and injuring 1,260.

title: The US Supreme Court hands down 5–3 decision in Stump v. Sparkman, a controversial case involving involuntary sterilization and judicial immunity.
text: The US Supreme Court hands down 5–3 decision in Stump v. Sparkman, a controversial case involving involuntary sterilization and judicial immunity.

title: A coolant leak at the Three Mile Island's Unit 2 nuclear reactor outside Harrisburg, Pennsylvania leads to the core overheating and a partial meltdown.
text: A coolant leak at the Three Mile Island's Unit 2 nuclear reactor outside Harrisburg, Pennsylvania leads to the core overheating and a partial meltdown.

title: The British House of Commons passes a vote of no confidence against James Callaghan’s government by 1 vote, precipitating a general election.
text: The British House of Commons passes a vote of no confidence against James Callaghan’s government by 1 vote, precipitating a general election.

title: United States President George H. W. Bush posthumously awards Jesse Owens the Congressional Gold Medal.
text: United States President George H. W. Bush posthumously awards Jesse Owens the Congressional Gold Medal.

title: In South Africa, African National Congress security guards kill dozens of Inkatha Freedom Party protesters.
text: In South Africa, African National Congress security guards kill dozens of Inkatha Freedom Party protesters.

title: Kosovo War: Serb paramilitary and military forces kill 146 Kosovo Albanians in Izbica.
text: Kosovo War: Serb paramilitary and military forces kill 146 Kosovo Albanians in Izbica.

title: In a friendly fire incident, two American A-10 Thunderbolt II aircraft attack British tanks participating in the 2003 invasion of Iraq, killing one soldier.
text: In a friendly fire incident, two American A-10 Thunderbolt II aircraft attack British tanks participating in the 2003 invasion of Iraq, killing one soldier.

title: An earthquake shakes northern Sumatra with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong), leaving 915–1,314 people dead and 340–1,146 injured.
text: An earthquake shakes northern Sumatra with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VI (Strong), leaving 915–1,314 people dead and 340–1,146 injured.

title: Massive protests are mounted against France's First Employment Contract law, meant to reduce youth unemployment.
